title: Has there been server connection issues, instability, for any other Time Warner users out there?
body:
It was an issue for me a week or two ago and just recently today the same thing has happened.

I have perfect ping and then 
everything freezes up and I DC, then it connects back, with varying lengths of disconnects.   I don't 
usually even see any ping spikes it happens so suddenly, but when I reconnect I can clearly see 
the ping falling back down to normalcy.

My internet connection 
does not have this issue with any thing else.

replies.body: Yeah. riot with copy pasta some generic settings stuff to every post . but its a prettycommon issue at the moment . just watch reckful stream at anypoint in time( austin tx )  and you will see the rubberbanding . I have same issues . Know a few other people intexas who also have the same problem. seems to be some issue with telnets routing

> [{quoted}](name=BOLDFONT,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EVRv9AAn,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-23T02:23:50.603+0000)
>
> Yeah. riot with copy pasta some generic settings stuff to every post . but its a prettycommon issue at the moment . just watch reckful stream at anypoint in time( austin tx )  and you will see the rubberbanding . I have same issues . Know a few other people intexas who also have the same problem. seems to be some issue with telnets routing

Feelsbad, I'm in Plano so I guess it's Texas related as you said.  

Hopefully tomorrow is just one of those lucky days where it works properly.   Can't play the game like that at all, it's too risky and feels horrible because it's totally out of our hands :/

We've been seeing some issues with players in the Texas area experiencing issues along their route to the server. It's likely that you'll need to reach out to your ISP tier 2 support for them to investigate and resolve the issue. If you'd like, you can run a set of traceroutes and post their results here so I can take a look and point out where any issues may lie.

If you'd like to do this, I recommend grabbing the [WinMTR application](http://winmtr.net/), then running a trace with the IP address 104.160.131.1 for 5 minutes. After you've passed 5 minutes, simply export the results as text and paste them in a reply to this post. 

Let me know if you have any questions.
